title: Can a therapist tell the police things you tell them? - Quora

response.answer_text: No. The only thing they can share is if you spoke with them about wanting to hurt/kill someone. I believe it would have to be a pretty straightforward type of confession - such as, “I am going to kill …..”. Or commit suicide. Whatever is said between a therapist/counselor holds privilege and the counselor cannot divulge your discussions without your consent. Unless, of course what I mentioned above.
Only with a court order signed by a judge in America. The weakness of this is that people communicate in euphemisms in order to further their personal agenda or secure themselves.
